items: Adjust the machine to fit your body by adjusting the seat and the lever arm.
Sit on the machine with your back against the backrest and your feet on the foot pad.
Grasp the handles on the side of the seat for stability.
Extend your legs out in front of you, keeping your knees slightly bent.
Slowly straighten your legs until they are fully extended.
Hold for a second and then slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Targets the quadriceps muscles, helping to strengthen and tone the front of the thighs
Isolates the quadriceps, reducing the involvement of other muscles and allowing for a more targeted workout
Can be adjusted to accommodate different fitness levels and abilities
May help improve knee stability and reduce the risk of injury
Can be performed with or without weights, making it a versatile exercise option
